job_title: Department Administrative Assistant in Randolph, NJ
pros: People truly care about their job and the students they are helping. Not a difficult job but every day is different which is nice. Very clean and all employees are kind. Once you get a job here you never leave! Benefits are great and so is PTO.
cons: Promotions are tough since no one really leaves their jobs (you get comfortable!) divide between departments, staff and faculty with admin. Pay is low (standard for a community college).

pros: Direct teaching, as an adjunct no requirements for publishing etc.
cons: Many changes at the college in the past five years, not all are positive for staff.

pros: Good benefits and decent work environment.
cons: Pay scale could be improved.

pros: Teaching students new tools and technologies to help them move forward in life
cons: Later hour concessions are lacking (coffee & soft drinks)

pros: Good people, good students, nice area
cons: salary is low for academia. the college is very political with respect to the administration. many have power who should not.

pros: Overall very easy for a college student. No experience required.
cons: Minimum wage pay. Limited hours.

review_title: Dedicated professor axed after busting butt through the pandemic
pros: They always paid me on time
cons: They were heartless in the way they terminated my employment.

review_title: Excellent place to hone skills while helping others
job_title: Mathematics Peer Tutor in Randolph, NJ
pros:
- The number of student-faculty and even student-tutor ratios are excellent in that they allow for the best development from both sides
- The facilities are clean, tidy, and good to work in
- People are very nice, both your coworkers and the students
cons: - Initially, getting the acceptance offer took a while, but other than that no real issues happened

pros: Convenient job to have in-between classes! Usually moderately busy, but when no one walks in you can work on homework.
cons: Mostly on your own and have to juggle handling multiple students with different issues at a time. Always gets busy around midterms and finals and can make your own workload heavier.

pros:
Great students
Wonderful faculty
Wide array of courses
cons: Very, very, extremely difficult administration

pros: CCM has a lot of flexibility
cons: There really was not any

pros: They've treated me with respect and loyalty for over 12 years. They've trusted me and given lots of freedom to craft two classes from scratch. The students are serious and care about their education. It's been a very positive experience that keeps me coming back every year.
cons: Just as I assume any school system would be, there is some internal political nonsense that gets in the way of good education and progress. Because it's a County College, Adjuncts salaries are low, but they are standard for the state.

pros: Individual employees are wonderful people. Staff workers are extremely dedicated to their job, the students and the success of the school.  Many things succeed despite leadership and management.
cons:
New leadership arrived in 2016.  President and executives are disconnected from the reality of the significant and ever growing morale problem.  It seems as though there is a concerted effort to eliminate and replace all middle level management individuals who do not enter lock step with the new president's poorly expressed vision.

In 5 years, I was never able to obtain written goals and objectives for my role.

review_title: Current employee about to be former employee
pros: Nice people to work with a real sense of community within the staff. Good benefits and a good work environment for some.
cons: No senior management initiative...not very progressive in their thinking.  Unwilling to ne innovative or manage effectively in times of crisis.  Unwilling to try new things. Faculty has too much say in how the organization is run.

review_title: I hated going to work everyday!
pros: I had a pension plan and benefits. I also meet and became friends with a few select people.
cons: CCM was a job a dead end job, their was no advancements or raises during my time there.  The pay was not on par with the cost of living. Many people I talked was working a second just to maintain.

job_title: Senior Chem/Bio Lab Aide in Randolph, NJ
pros: Great place to study. Work wasn't too hard and I leaned a lot about the lab and have great contacts I still keep in touch with today.
cons: Quick turn over and not a lot of room for advancement in my position. I cant really think of anything else I loved this job.

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Randolph, NJ
pros: The people you work with are some of the best in their fields. If you get hired its VERY difficult to be let go.
cons: The administration is short sighted and slowly realizing that the years of plenty are behind them. Your upward mobility is dictated exclusively by what degree you hold. Pay is on the low side for most positions. Benefits are only for the full-time union employees.

pros: Great co-workers and staff, friendly for the most part.
cons: Indiscriminately let long- time employees go for financial reasons while keeping less qualified employees.

pros: Excellent work environment and collegues. 9 month contract for fulltime faculty.
cons: Without teaching experience the starting salary is low.

pros: Great opportunities to improve skills
cons: upper management heavy, changing culture

pros: Great co workers and administration
cons: Nothing I can think of

review_title: Poor pay, no advancement, benefits getting worse
pros: they close for snow, cost of benefits is low
cons: low pay, no room for advancements, no merit raises. Laike most GOV jobs it's who you know
